greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = n*fibonacci(n) * Sum_{d|n} 1/(d*fibonacci(d)).
link: Paul D. Hanna, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..200
formula: Equals the logarithmic derivative of A203318.
(1) L(x) = Sum_{n>=1} x^n/n * Sum_{k>=0} F(n*k+n)/F(n) * x^(n*k) where F(n) = fibonacci(n).
(2) L(x) = Sum_{n>=1} x^n/n * exp( Sum_{k>=1} Lucas(n*k)*x^(n*k)/k ) ) where Lucas(n) = A000032(n).
(4) L(x) = Sum_{n>=1} x^n/n * G_n(x^n) where G_n(x^n) = Product_{k=0..n-1} G(u^k*x) where G(x) = 1/(1-x-x^2) and u is an n-th root of unity.
example: Exponentiation of the l.g.f. equals the g.f. of A203318:
mathematica: a[n_] := n Fibonacci[n] DivisorSum[n, 1/(# Fibonacci[#]) &]; Array[a, 40] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Dec 23 2015 *)
program: {a(n)=local(L=x); L=sum(m=1, n, x^m/m*exp(sum(k=1, floor((n+1)/m), Lucas(m*k)*x^(m*k)/k)+x*O(x^n))); n*polcoeff(L,n)}
(PARI) {a(n)=local(A=1+x+x*O(x^n),F=1/(1-x-x^2+x*O(x^n))); A=exp(sum(m=1, n+1, x^m/m*round(prod(k=0, m-1, subst(F, x, exp(2*Pi*I*k/m)*x+x*O(x^n)))))); n*polcoeff(log(A), n)}
results.author: _Paul D. Hanna_, Jan 01 2012
